intro: Urirandra madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar uriri, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
